title: 5 Timeless Cabinet Styles That Will Always Look Good
description: Cabinets are one of the most important elements in any kitchen. They take up a lot of space, set the overall tone of the room, and aren’t something you want to replace often. Trends change quickly, but some cabinet styles never go out of fashion. These styles have remained popular for decades because they’re versatile, […] You're reading 5 Timeless Cabinet Styles That Will Always Look Good, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Daniel Mitchell
excerpt: Cabinets are one of the most important elements in any kitchen. They take up a lot of space, set the overall tone of the room, and aren’t something you
text: Cabinets are one of the most important elements in any kitchen. They take up a lot of space, set the overall tone of the room, and aren’t something you want to replace often. Trends change quickly, but some cabinet styles never go out of fashion. These styles have remained popular for decades because they’re versatile, practical, and easy to update. Whether you like a modern, classic, or rustic look, there’s a timeless cabinet style that will work for your space. Shaker Cabinets Shaker cabinets are one of the most popular styles for a reason. Their simple, clean design makes them fit in with almost any decor. The flat panels and straight edges give them a classic but unfussy look. They can be painted, stained, or left natural, making them easy to customize, and they also work well with a variety of hardware styles, from sleek metal pulls to vintage-style knobs. Unlike overly decorative cabinets that can feel dated, Shaker cabinets are always in style because of their simplicity. They’re a safe choice for anyone who wants a look that won’t need updating every few years. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / staRRush Raised-Panel Cabinets Raised-panel cabinets are a traditional choice that has been around for generations. They have a slightly more decorative look than flat-panel cabinets, but they’re not overly ornate. The raised center panel adds depth and dimension, making them a great fit for classic kitchens. These cabinets are most commonly seen in wood finishes, but they can also be painted for a softer, more modern feel. White, cream, and gray are popular choices that help keep them looking fresh. While they lean more toward a formal style, they can be paired with simple hardware and modern lighting to make them feel more current.’ Photo Credit: Envato Elements / LightFieldStudios Glass-Front Cabinets Glass-front cabinets add some openness and elegance to a kitchen. They’ve been around for decades, used in both traditional and modern designs. The glass allows you to display dishes, glassware, or decorative pieces, making them feel more personalized. They also help break up the visual heaviness of a full wall of cabinets. One of the reasons glass-front cabinets remain timeless is their flexibility, since they can be mixed with solid cabinets, used in small sections, or even added to upper cabinets only for a lighter feel. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / Rawpixel Two-Tone Cabinets Two-tone cabinets have been around for decades and continue to be a popular choice. The idea is simple: use one color or finish for the upper cabinets and a different one for the lower cabinets. This creates visual contrast and makes the space feel more dynamic. A classic example is white upper cabinets paired with darker lower cabinets, such as navy, gray, or natural wood. This style works well because it allows for a mix of light and dark without committing to one all-over color. Since it’s based on balance rather than trends, two-tone cabinets continue to feel fresh year after year. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / staRRush Classic White Cabinets White cabinets have been a staple in kitchens for generations. They make a space feel bright, open, and clean, which is why they never go out of style. Unlike trendy colors that come and go, a soft, neutral white always looks fresh. White cabinets also work well with a variety of hardware, countertops, and backsplashes, making them incredibly versatile. If you ever want a change, you can update the look with new handles or a fresh coat of paint without having to replace the cabinets entirely. Their timeless appeal comes from their ability to fit into any style, whether traditional, modern, or in between. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / Sonyachny When choosing cabinets, it’s easy to get caught up in trends. But the best choice is often a style that has stood the test of time. Simple designs, quality materials, and versatile colors are what keep certain cabinet styles from looking outdated. Whether you prefer something modern, classic, or a mix of both, these cabinet styles will always be a safe and stylish choice. Dan is a writer with many years' experience under his belt, covering everything from entertainment news to astrology. He's now following his creativity and writing interior design content for everyone looking to brighten their space. Outside of writing, Dan enjoys embroidery, birdwatching, playing video games, all things horror, coffee, and his[...]
html:
Cabinets are one of the most important elements in any kitchen. They take up a lot of space, set the overall tone of the room, and aren’t something you want to replace often. Trends change quickly, but some cabinet styles never go out of fashion. These styles have remained popular for decades because they’re versatile, practical, and easy to update. Whether you like a modern, classic, or rustic look, there’s a timeless cabinet style that will work for your space.

Shaker Cabinets

Shaker cabinets are one of the most popular styles for a reason. Their simple, clean design makes them fit in with almost any decor. The flat panels and straight edges give them a classic but unfussy look. They can be painted, stained, or left natural, making them easy to customize, and they also work well with a variety of hardware styles, from sleek metal pulls to vintage-style knobs. Unlike overly decorative cabinets that can feel dated, Shaker cabinets are always in style because of their simplicity. They’re a safe choice for anyone who wants a look that won’t need updating every few years.

Raised-Panel Cabinets

Raised-panel cabinets are a traditional choice that has been around for generations. They have a slightly more decorative look than flat-panel cabinets, but they’re not overly ornate. The raised center panel adds depth and dimension, making them a great fit for classic kitchens. These cabinets are most commonly seen in wood finishes, but they can also be painted for a softer, more modern feel. White, cream, and gray are popular choices that help keep them looking fresh. While they lean more toward a formal style, they can be paired with simple hardware and modern lighting to make them feel more current.’

Glass-Front Cabinets

Glass-front cabinets add some openness and elegance to a kitchen. They’ve been around for decades, used in both traditional and modern designs. The glass allows you to display dishes, glassware, or decorative pieces, making them feel more personalized. They also help break up the visual heaviness of a full wall of cabinets. One of the reasons glass-front cabinets remain timeless is their flexibility, since they can be mixed with solid cabinets, used in small sections, or even added to upper cabinets only for a lighter feel.

Two-Tone Cabinets

Two-tone cabinets have been around for decades and continue to be a popular choice. The idea is simple: use one color or finish for the upper cabinets and a different one for the lower cabinets. This creates visual contrast and makes the space feel more dynamic. A classic example is white upper cabinets paired with darker lower cabinets, such as navy, gray, or natural wood. This style works well because it allows for a mix of light and dark without committing to one all-over color. Since it’s based on balance rather than trends, two-tone cabinets continue to feel fresh year after year.

Classic White Cabinets

White cabinets have been a staple in kitchens for generations. They make a space feel bright, open, and clean, which is why they never go out of style. Unlike trendy colors that come and go, a soft, neutral white always looks fresh. White cabinets also work well with a variety of hardware, countertops, and backsplashes, making them incredibly versatile. If you ever want a change, you can update the look with new handles or a fresh coat of paint without having to replace the cabinets entirely. Their timeless appeal comes from their ability to fit into any style, whether traditional, modern, or in between.

When choosing cabinets, it’s easy to get caught up in trends. But the best choice is often a style that has stood the test of time. Simple designs, quality materials, and versatile colors are what keep certain cabinet styles from looking outdated. Whether you prefer something modern, classic, or a mix of both, these cabinet styles will always be a safe and stylish choice.

Dan is a writer with many years' experience under his belt, covering everything from entertainment news to astrology. He's now following his creativity and writing interior design content for everyone looking to brighten their space. Outside of writing, Dan enjoys embroidery, birdwatching, playing video games, all things horror, coffee, and his[...]
